0: NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEW BRUNSWICK – Caitlyn Kovacs, the 19-year-old Rutgers University sophomore whose death in September touched off a county investigation, died of alcohol poisoning, authorities said on Monday. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Kovacs died from “acute ethanol toxicity” and the manner of death was accidental, according to Middlesex County Prosecutor Andrew C. Carey, who cited a county medical examiner’s report. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “The cause of death was determined following completion of toxicology tests,” Carey said in a press release. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Friends took Kovacs, a Monmouth Junction resident, to a hospital about 3 a.m. Sept. 21 after she appeared to be in distress during a party at the Delta Kappa Epsilon fraternity house on College Avenue. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR She was pronounced dead at Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital in New Brunswick. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Police began investigating after hospital officials alerted them of her death. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Lorraine Kovacs said her daughter’s friends described the sophomore as a social drinker, but not a heavy drinker. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The prosecutor called the investigation “active and continuing” and urged anyone with information to come forward. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Anyone with information is asked to call Lt. Paul Fischer of the Rutgers University Police Department at
